intro: Cyrtogonium subcrenatum, commonly known as the wavy-leaf water fern, is a delicate aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four lobes with wavy margins. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and wetlands. Its reproductive structures include small, submerged flowers that produce minute fruits. Cyrtogonium subcrenatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
